acf.heading: Get gabapentin online.
acf.first_paragraph: Gabapentin is often used in conjunction with other medications to control and prevent seizures. It’s also used to help relieve nerve pain from shingles and other painful skin rashes or infections.

accordion.accordion_title: What is gabapentin and how does it work?
accordion.accordion_intro: Gabapentin is known as an anticonvulsant or antiepileptic drug known most predominantly to treat and prevent seizures. It works by altering chemicals in the brain called neurotransmitters, which send messages between nerve cells.
accordion.accordion_content: If you think you need gabapentin, you can speak to a doctor on Maple to see if it’s right for you.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the uses for gabapentin?
accordion.accordion_intro: Gabapentin is a form of medication used to prevent and treat the intensity and occurrence of seizures in both adults and children.
accordion.accordion_content: It’s also used to help reduce the burning or stabbing nerve pain that is a common complication of shingles infection.

accordion.accordion_intro: Take gabapentin by mouth with or without food as directed by your doctor. Dosage is based on your medical condition and response to treatment. For children, the dosage is also based on weight.
accordion.accordion_content: If you are taking the tablets and your doctor directs you to split the tablet in half, take the other half-tablet at your next scheduled dose. If you are taking the capsules, swallow them whole with plenty of water. It is very important to follow your doctor’s dosing instructions exactly. During the first few days of treatment, your doctor may gradually increase your dose so your body can adjust to the medication. To minimize side effects, take the very first dose at bedtime.

accordion.accordion_title: What are the side effects and risks of gabapentin?
accordion.accordion_intro:
You should always speak with a doctor to make sure that gabapentin is right for you. Possible side effects include:

  • Drowsiness and dizziness
  • Loss of coordination
  • Blurred/double vision
  • Unusual eye movements
  • Shaking or tremors
accordion.accordion_content: You may also experience depression, suicidal thoughts/attempts, or other mental/mood problems. It is advised that you tell your doctor right away if you experience swelling of the hands, ankles or feet as well as slow/shallow breathing.

accordion.accordion_intro: Gabapentin should not be taken by anyone who is breastfeeding, operating heavy machinery, or has drug and alcohol misuse issues.
accordion.accordion_content: If you’d like to speak to a doctor about getting gabapentin, click here to register for an account.
